availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Irvine Moore (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. )

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Clark County, Kentucky, native. Son of Thomas Ransdale Moore and Eveline Walker Hockaday Moore. Married to Emily Malone Raymond Moore in Hamilton County, Ohio, on March 25, 1856. Father of Ervine Moore, Florence Moore, and Thomas H. Moore. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Clark County in 1860. Held six additional enslaved persons in trust in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 815.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 15.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 8.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Minnesota, Douglas County, Superior, p. 76B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Minnesota, Duluth County, St. Paul, p. 2.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Greene County Marriages, Film #000344470.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, Ky, National #67401, State #1406.
